document_title: Stage 2 breast cancer: Symptoms, treatment and prognosis
subsection_name: ung-thu-vu-giai-doan-2.json_2_Symptoms of stage II breast cancer
subsection_content:
When suffering from stage II breast cancer, patients may experience some symptoms such as:
A lump in the breast or armpit; Change in size or shape of the breast.
With stage II breast cancer, the patient can feel the tumor in the breast or armpit on the same side.
According to Dr. Tran Thi Thien Huong, PhD, Department of Oncology, Tam Anh General Hospital, Ho Chi Minh City, the stage of cancer indicates the size - the degree of invasion of the malignant tumor and the degree of metastasis. Based on the stage of cancer and the biological properties of the tumor, doctors can recommend appropriate treatment methods.
To determine the stage of the disease, in addition to tests to diagnose the disease such as breast ultrasound, mammography, breast MRI, breast lesion biopsy, patients need to do a number of other whole-body examination methods such as: ultrasound. Abdominal ultrasound, neck ultrasound, chest X-ray or abdominal CT scan, chest CT scan, brain CT scan, bone scan... (depending on tumor status, tumor biology and organ symptoms).
To know the biological properties of the tumor, on specimens with confirmed cancer, additional tests are needed to determine the status of estrogen receptors (ER), progesterone (PR), and growth factor receptors. (HER2), evaluate the level of cell proliferation (Ki67) or BRCA gene mutations (on specimens with confirmed cancer, or in the blood).
In addition, patients also need to evaluate accompanying diseases to coordinate the safest treatment.
